John Matthew Heard, Jr. (March 7, 1945 – July 21, 2017) was an American actor, who appeared in the show Miami Vice as Laurence Thurmond, a defense attorney who is a friend of ADA Robert Langley (and defending his killer Philippe Sagot, and working for Jean Faber) and has an adversarial relationship with James "Sonny" Crockett in the episode "One Way Ticket"

Career[]

Heard was born in Washington, D.C. He graduated from Clark University in Massachusetts, then performed off-Broadway. He appeared in numerous TV & movie roles, his most known role was as Kevin McCallister's father Peter in Home Alone and its' sequel, Home Alone 2: Lost In New York.

Some of his other roles follow:

Hallmark Hall of Fame (TV, 1975, first TV appearance)

Rush It (1976, first movie appearance, with Anthony Holland)

Between The Lines (1977, with Joe Morton)

On The Yard (1978, with Thomas G. Waites & J.C. Quinn)
